name: Philadelphia Trust, Safe Deposit and Insurance Company v. Loder, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Philadelphia Trust, Safe Deposit & Insurance v. Loder

judges: Before McCollum, C. J., Mitchell, Dean, Pell, Brown, Mestrezat and Potter, JJ.
parties: Philadelphia Trust, Safe Deposit and Insurance Company v. Loder, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Mitchell,
This case involves the same question as Bornot v. Bonschur, opinion filed herewith, and must be reversed for the reasons there given.
Decree reversed with directions to dismiss the bill with costs.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Mitchell,

attorneys: John Gr. Johnson, with him Henry J. Scott, for appellant.
Rowland Evans and R. L. Ashhurst, for appellee.
James Alcorn &ná. JohnL. Kinsey, for the city of Philadelphia.
casebody.head_matter:
Philadelphia Trust, Safe Deposit and Insurance Company v. Loder, Appellant.
May 19, 1902:
Argued Jan. 14, 1902.
Appeal, No. 277, Jan. T., 1901, by defendant from decree of C. P. No. 2, Phila. Co., June T., 1896, No. 992, on bill in equity in ease of Philadelphia Trust, Safe Deposit and Insurance Company, Trustees of George W. Conarroe, Deceased, and George W. Conarroe, v. Constantine G. A. Loder.
Before McCollum, C. J., Mitchell, Dean, Pell, Brown, Mestrezat and Potter, JJ.
Reversed.
John Gr. Johnson, with him Henry J. Scott, for appellant.
Rowland Evans and R. L. Ashhurst, for appellee.
James Alcorn &ná. JohnL. Kinsey, for the city of Philadelphia.
